title: Tigers topple Guardians in wild card, reach ALDS
content: The Detroit Tigers have defeated the Cleveland Guardians 6-3, advancing to the American League Division Series.

title: Clark: Collier made 'valid points' about Engelbert
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark said Napheesa Collier "made a lot of very valid points" this week when the Minnesota Lynx star ripped WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert.

title: PGA of America prez apologizes to Rory, Euros
content: PGA of America president Don Rea Jr. apologized to Rory McIlroy and the European Ryder Cup team, condemning fan behavior that "crossed the line" at Bethpage.

title: Hamilton joins Lamar as Ravens to miss practice
content: Lamar Jackson didn't practice for a second straight day for the Ravens, whose injury concerns continue to grow. Pro Bowl safety Kyle Hamilton also did not practice on Thursday after injuring his groin the day before.

title: Doncic, Lakers focused on 'championship shape'
content: The Lakers ended their last practice before their six-game preseason slate tips off Friday with a gamut of lung-pumping runs, part of coach JJ Redick's philosophy of having his team in top shape ahead of the regular season.

title: Semenya ends legal battle over sex eligibility rules
content: Olympic champion runner Caster Semenya is ending a seven-year legal challenge against sex eligibility rules in track and field, her lawyers said Thursday.

title: Coveted 2026 hoops recruit commits to UConn
content: Fast-rising four-star senior guard Junior County, the No. 43 recruit in the 2026 SC Next 100, told ESPN that he has committed to UConn.

title: Poch: 'Your name' won't guarantee World Cup spot
content: On the day that United States manager Mauricio Pochettino brought several players back into the fold, he reiterated his stance that reputations count for nothing when it comes to securing a World Cup roster spot.

title: üìà Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards: The top candidates to win MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: WNBA Finals: Aces-Mercury predictions, preview, odds
content: A'ja Wilson's Aces seek their third title in four years. Phoenix is chasing its first since 2014. The Finals open Friday.

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: Here are the top scenes from Abu Dhabi as the Philadelphia 76ers and New York Knicks face off in a preseason doubleheader.

title: 'Can't complain; I'm liking life': Mitch Marner begins his Vegas era
content: The top free agent from the summer is ready to begin a new chapter with an elite Western Conference contender.

title: The time for experimentation is over: USMNT squad sees Pochettino's World Cup vision come into focus
content: Mauricio Pochettino has been experimenting with his USMNT lineup for some time, but judging by his October squad, his World Cup team is taking shape.

title: Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid ... Qarabag? Making sense of Champions League MD2
content: Big clubs (Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid) and small ones (FK Qarabag?!) shone on Champions League MD2 as several results made an impact on teams' chances of advancing. Let's break down the teams, matches and power ranking.

title: The new World Cup ball is here! How a century of evolution has led to 2026's Trionda
content: We look at every World Cup ball, from the first almost 100 years ago to the new Trionda that will be used in Canada, Mexico and the U.S. next summer.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 5
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: NFL kickoffs: Rules change results in most returns in history through Week 4
content: Here's a look at how the latest tweak to kickoffs resulted in yet another big jump in special teams action.

title: 10 NBA teams that gained -- or lost -- the most value in offseason deals
content: From trades to free agency to the draft, these teams will see boosts -- or declines -- from a summer of deals.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Betting buzz: Ravens swing from favorite to underdog amid Jackson injury rumors
content: Amid speculation around Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury, the Ravens have swung from favorite to underdogs on Sunday.

title: College football betting: Buckeyes, Ducks the favorites for national title, Heisman
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet them.

title: Tottenham takeover: Top scenes from Vikings-Browns in London
content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

title: Boxing real or not: Gervonta Davis' future, Teofimo-Shakur, more
content: Andreas Hale on what's next for Gervonta Davis after Jake Paul, Terence Crawford's next move and more.

title: What Premier League pass maps tell us: Salah needs the ball, Man United rely on Shaw
content: The top Premier League teams have passed the ball in certain ways that betray either a weakness or a strength. What have we learned so far?

title: Every time Man United's Ruben Amorim has talked about his job
content: Ahead of a must-win match against Sunderland, here is everything Amorim has said about his job so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Konat√© could reject Madrid approach
content: Could Ibrahima Konat√© end up staying at Liverpool, despite interest from Real Madrid? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Trading firm levels graft, harassment allegations against customs staff in TN
content: Wintrack Inc. CEO Prawin Ganeshan has accused Chennai customs officials of corruption and harassment, alleging bribery demands and goods being held up. He announced halting exports and imports from India due to these issues, prompting the revenue department to launch a senior-level investigation into the serious claims. The company fears retaliation after going public.

title: Tariff war: 'India won‚Äôt allow its humiliation', says Russia's Putin; warns US
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the United States against pressuring India to stop buying Russian oil. He stated India would not tolerate humiliation. Putin mentioned Prime Minister Modi would not take such steps. He said India would suffer losses if it refused Russian energy supplies. Putin also blamed NATO countries for the Ukraine conflict.

title: Tension in Bareilly: Drones are up ahead of Friday prayer; internet shut down
content: Bareilly suspended internet services, including mobile data and broadband, from October 2 to October 4, fearing unrest during Friday prayers. This precaution follows last week's clashes over an 'I Love Muhammad' procession, which led to over 80 arrests, including prominent cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan. Security remains heavily deployed across the division.

title: 'Colossal tragedy': Leh still in shock, but firm on statehood; locals recall Sep 24
content: Ladakh faced unrest after a September 24 protest. Four people died during security forces' response. Activist Sonam Wangchuk ended his hunger strike. He sought Sixth Schedule status and statehood. Residents demand a judicial inquiry into the deaths. Local leaders continue their call for self-governance. The region seeks resolution for its demands.

title: Road to Karachi is through Sir Creek: Rajnath to Pak; warns against military build-up
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh issued a stern warning to Pakistan regarding its military build-up near the sensitive Sir Creek region, threatening a strong response that would alter the area's history and geography. He also revealed details of "Operation Sindoor," where India successfully countered Pakistani attempts to penetrate its borders, emphasizing India's targeted fight against terrorism while showing restraint.

title: Microsoft leadership change: CEO freed from some duties - Read Nadella‚Äôs email to staff
content: Microsoft is reorganizing its top leadership, appointing Judson Althoff as CEO of Commercial Business to oversee marketing and operations. This strategic shift allows CEO Satya Nadella and engineering leaders to intensely focus on AI, data center expansion, and product development. The move aims to accelerate AI transformation and strengthen customer feedback loops across the company.

title: MP: Tractor-trolley overturns in pond during Durga idol immersion; 11 drown
content: Eleven people, mostly teenagers, drowned in a pond in MP's Khandwa district when a tractor-trolley carrying Durga idol immersion devotees overturned on Vijayadashami. The vehicle lost balance and toppled into the water, despite a warning to the driver. Seven females and eight minors were among the deceased in the tragic accident.

title: 'Review needed': Bhagwat rings ‚Äòwarning bell‚Äô on Himalayas; flags ecology threats
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat warned against environmental degradation, particularly in the Himalayas, attributing it to faulty development models and consumerism. He also stressed the need for stronger security and economic self-reliance amid regional turmoil and global economic pressures. Bhagwat highlighted systemic flaws like the rich-poor gap, advocating for national unity and vigilance.

title: Accenture job cuts: Company lays off thousands that can't be AI trained; what CEO said
content: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.

title: US govt shutdown: How long will the deadlock continue; what to expect in coming days
content: The United States government has entered a shutdown after Congress failed to reach a spending agreement, triggering widespread disruption across federal agencies. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers face furloughs or delayed pay, while essential services continue without immediate compensation. The closure's duration is uncertain, with significant economic costs and a need for political compromise to resolve the deadlock.

title: Thaw in ties: India, China to restart direct flights this month; first in 5 yrs
content: India announced the resumption of direct air services with China from late October, a significant step towards normalizing bilateral relations. This follows PM Modi's recent meeting with President Xi Jinping and earlier tourist visa resumption, aiming to boost people-to-people contact and economic cooperation. IndiGo will launch Kolkata-Guangzhou flights on October 26.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won‚Äôt be updated until‚Ä¶
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: In a 1st, India set to host a Taliban minister next week; cooperation on agenda
content: India's ties with the Taliban are set to intensify. Acting foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi will likely visit India on October 9-10. He will meet External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar. This marks the first visit by a senior Taliban official since 2021. India secured a UNSC travel ban waiver for Muttaqi.

title: ‚ÄòCommunal with totalitarian outlook‚Äô: Congress cites Gandhi; attacks RSS
content: Congress asserted Thursday that Mahatma Gandhi labeled RSS a ‚Äúcommunal body with totalitarian outlook,‚Äù citing his secretary‚Äôs book. This statement came as Congress leaders honored Gandhi, contrasting with BJP‚Äôs tribute to the RSS. Spokesperson Jairam Ramesh highlighted that Sardar Patel banned RSS five months after Gandhi‚Äôs observation and later warned against groups challenging the national flag.

title: MP: Tribal girl aims to bend it like Beckham; teen to join German football club
content: Suhani Kol, a 15-year-old from Shahdol, will train at FC Ingolstadt 04 in Germany. She is one of five selected footballers for this program. Suhani, a Class X student, plays as a goalkeeper. Her journey includes overcoming personal tragedy. She leaves for Germany to train with German coach Dietmar Beiersdorfer. This opportunity marks a step for the athlete.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs contract extension in doubt after Kirill Kaprizov‚Äôs massive deal
content: Connor McDavid's contract future with the Edmonton Oilers is under intense scrutiny following Kirill Kaprizov's massive deal. Despite McDavid's potential for a record-setting salary, the Oilers face significant cap challenges due to existing high-value contracts. McDavid prioritizes winning a Stanley Cup, suggesting he might accept less to ensure a competitive team, forcing Edmonton to find creative financial solutions.

title: Will George Kittle play vs Rams tonight? Latest injury update on 49ers‚Äô star TE
content: San Francisco 49ers' star tight end George Kittle will not play against the Los Angeles Rams tonight as he recovers from a hamstring injury. Kittle is on short-term injured reserve and is ineligible to return until after this game, with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers match being his earliest potential comeback.

title: Inside Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner‚Äôs private love story lasting 15 years
content: Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner maintain a private relationship. Leutner began modeling in 2005, appearing in Sports Illustrated in 2011. She works with fashion brands. Crosby achieved significant hockey success. They met in 2008. Both built impressive careers. They prioritize privacy. Their bond thrives away from public attention.

title: UP: 3 dead, 5 missing after 9 swept away in Agra; SDRF teams deployed
content: Tragedy struck Agra as three men died and five went missing during Durga idol immersion in the Utangan river on Thursday. The group entered an undesignated spot after being turned away from official sites, where strong currents swept them away. Rescue operations are underway, with one person saved so far. Authorities had warned against using non-designated immersion points.

title: 1984 tension: Indira blocked Rajiv‚Äôs Bhindranwale meeting - new book claims
content: A new book highlights how political interference and missed opportunities allowed Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale to escalate tensions before 1984. Indira Gandhi's attempts for Rajiv to secretly meet Bhindranwale failed twice due to safety concerns, infuriating him. These cancellations, coupled with his quick 1981 release, led to the tragic 1984 events.

title: 'Democratic system under ‚Äòwholesale‚Äô attack', says Rahul; BJP hits back
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, speaking in Colombia, asserted that India is experiencing a "wholesale attack on its democratic system," advocating for diverse traditions to flourish. He highlighted risks to India's structure. The BJP vehemently criticized his statements, accusing him of insulting the nation on foreign soil and defaming India, citing his electoral rejections as motivation for his remarks.

title: Chhattisgarh: 103 Reds, 49 with Rs 1cr bounty on their heads, surrender in Bastar
content: Chhattisgarh delivered a significant blow to Maoists as 103 Naxals, including 49 carrying a cumulative Rs 1 crore reward, surrendered in Bijapur. Each received Rs 50,000 under the rehabilitation policy, marking a defeat for Maoist ideology and their parallel governance structures. Officials urged remaining cadres to embrace the policy, following 410 surrenders this year.

title: Nanak birth anniversary: Centre allows Sikh jathas to visit Pak; caution advised
content: The Centre has reversed its earlier ban, now permitting Sikh jathas to visit Pakistan for Guru Nanak Dev's parkash purb, bringing relief to devotees. Initially citing security concerns for November 2025, the government faced strong criticism from Sikh leaders. This decision, following community backlash, allows pilgrims to fulfill their long-held religious aspirations at sacred gurdwaras across the border.

title: NIRF revamp: Govt to penalise research fraud; tainted citations face cuts
content: India's National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) is undergoing a significant overhaul, introducing a negative marking system for research malpractice. Universities will face penalties for retracted papers and their citations, aiming to curb academic dishonesty and misrepresentation. This stricter approach seeks to enhance research credibility and may lead to debarment for persistent offenders, signalling zero tolerance for academic fraud.

title: Kovind quotes ex-PM Vajpayee‚Äôs ‚ÄòBhim Smriti‚Äô speech, hails RSS
content: Former President Ram Nath Kovind, addressing the RSS centenary, lauded Dr. B.R. Ambedkar and the Sangh Parivar's pro-Constitution stance. He quoted Atal Bihari Vajpayee's declaration of governance based on "Bhim Smriti," countering "Manuwadi" accusations. Kovind also noted Mahatma Gandhi and Ambedkar's admiration for RSS discipline and inclusivity, with Ambedkar reportedly feeling a "sense of belonging" during a 1940 visit.

title: 'Patriotic organisation': VP says RSS embraces all; hails Sangh's 'inclusiveness'
content: Vice-President C P Radhakrishnan extended best wishes to the RSS on its centenary, praising its inclusive approach that embraces all without distinction. He highlighted its role in national progress and its "man-making ethos" for creating self-disciplined, responsible citizens. The VP described the RSS as the world's foremost patriotic organization, attributing its enduring success to fostering unity in diversity.

title: Who is India Love? Meet Shilo Sanders‚Äô rumored girlfriend amid his NFL future doubts
content: NFL prospect Shilo Sanders is reportedly linked to popular influencer India Love, sparking fan frenzy given his private nature. The rumors intensified after a man, believed to be Sanders, called Love during a livestream, with his voice sounding familiar. India Love, known for her reality show "The Westbrooks," has not confirmed the speculation, leaving fans eager for details.

title: Cybercrime crackdown: ED seizes Rs 8.5k cr assets; nationwide probe launched
content: The Enforcement Directorate has initiated a massive nationwide crackdown on cybercrimes across 28 cities, uncovering over Rs 28,000 crore in illicit gains and seizing assets exceeding Rs 8,500 crore. This extensive operation, involving zonal offices, has led to 106 arrests. Notable cases include the Mahadev Online Betting App, where Rs 8,000 crore was laundered by masterminds operating from abroad.

title: Uttar Pradesh: Sambhal mosque razed; 2nd demolition in 4 months
content: Sambhal authorities demolished a mosque and a 30,000-sq-ft marriage hall, allegedly built illegally on government pond land. These decade-old structures were declared encroachments after a recent survey. This marks the second mosque demolition in four months. Notices were issued, but owners failed to act, leading to the bulldozer action under heavy police presence.

title: 'He gets mad at me': Travis Kelce‚Äôs latest clash with Andy Reid
content: Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce voiced frustration over his steadily decreasing playing time, despite the team's recent win against the Ravens. His snap percentage dropped significantly, yet he remains highly productive this season. Coach Andy Reid acknowledged Kelce's desire to play every snap, taking responsibility for managing his reps.

title: Pilibhit: ‚ÄòMystery fever‚Äô kills 4 in 3 days; over 100 people sick
content: An undiagnosed fever outbreak in Pilibhit's Rasiakhanpur village has claimed four lives, including an infant, within three days, affecting over 100 villagers. The health department dispatched teams for intensive screening and blood tests to diagnose the "mystery fever." They plan appropriate treatment and insecticide fogging, while residents fear a major outbreak.

title: Judge: Gandhi, Shastri life guided humanity to focus on self-reliance
content: Senior SC judge Justice Surya Kant paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri, highlighting their philosophies of village focus, self-reliance, and simple living. He noted Gandhi's role in empowering rural masses and linking true freedom to dignity for the vulnerable and justice for the marginalized, offering enduring guidance.

title: 'Block Everything': Paris' Eiffel Tower closed amid nationwide protests
content: France experienced widespread strikes and protests on Thursday, disrupting daily life and closing the Eiffel Tower. Thousands marched across 200 cities, demanding higher taxes on the wealthy and opposing proposed spending cuts. Unions are pressuring new Prime Minister Lecornu to abandon austerity measures. While turnout was lower than last month, the demonstrations highlight significant social anger ahead of budget discussions.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row fallout: Bareilly on high alert, drones deployed; net suspended
content: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly division is under heightened security for Dussehra, with drones and armed police deployed. Bareilly district faces a 48-hour internet suspension until October 4, following September 26 unrest. This measure aims to curb rumour-mongering and communal tension on social media. Four districts are on high alert, with officials warned against lapses.

title: 'Ball went everywhere ‚Ä¶': Rishabh Pant's hilarious golf fail goes viral ‚Äì watch
content: Injured Rishabh Pant shared a hilarious golf video, providing comic relief as India began their Test series against West Indies. Meanwhile, India asserted dominance on the field, with Siraj and Bumrah decimating the visitors and Rahul anchoring the innings.

title: 'Being dealt with': Revenue dept to probe Wintrack's Chennai customs 'corruption' claims
content: The Finance Ministry said on Thursday that the Department of Revenue (DoR) has been asked to undertake a fair, transparent, and fact-based inquiry following allegations made by Wintrack Inc (Chennai) of "corruption and harassment" against Chennai Customs and the matter is being "with utmost seriousness".

title: 'Those who ran ...': Uddhav's veiled jab at Shinde; calls BJP 'amoeba'
content: Uddhav Thackeray, at a Dussehra rally, jabbed at defectors as "brass" while calling loyalists "gold." He accused the BJP of 'vote chori' and communal politics, demanding central funds for rain-hit Maharashtra farmers. Thackeray also vowed to expose the BJP's alleged "loot" of the BMC if his party wins civic elections.

title: Caitlin Clark backs Napheesa Collier as WNBA chief Cathy Engelbert faces backlash
content: WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert is under fire after Napheesa Collier revealed Engelbert's remarks suggesting Caitlin Clark should be grateful for the league's platform and sponsorships. Clark supported Collier's criticism of league leadership, emphasizing the need for accountability during this crucial time. Engelbert expressed being "disheartened" by Collier's claims but maintained her commitment to the league.

title: ICC Women's World Cup: Bangladesh hammer Pakistan by seven wickets
content: Bangladesh secured a commanding seven-wicket victory over Pakistan in their ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup 2025 opener. Rubya Haider's unbeaten half-century and a crucial partnership with skipper Nigar Sultana powered the chase of 130. Earlier, Marufa Akter and Nahida Akter led a disciplined bowling attack, dismantling Pakistan's batting lineup.

title: H-1B visa crackdown: Global talent map redrawn; is India winning?
content: Stricter H-1B and L-1 visa rules under US President Donald Trump are pushing American companies to shift operations to India, which now hosts over 1,800 Global Capability Centres (GCCs). These hubs are driving innovation across sectors like AI and cybersecurity. With visa costs rising to $100,000 and new restrictions looming, firms are investing in India-based centres for cost-effective talent. India‚Äôs IT sector continues to grow, projecting $100 billion in GCC revenue by 2030.

title: Thaw in ties: India, China to resume direct flights by month-end
content: India and China are set to resume direct passenger flights by late October 2025, a significant move announced by the ministry of external affairs following technical discussions. This decision aims to restore normalcy in bilateral ties and expand people-to-people contact, contingent on commercial decisions and fulfilling operational criteria by designated carriers.

title: Controversy erupts! Pakistani commentator refers to 'Azad Kashmir' during match
content: Former Pakistan captain Sana Mir sparked outrage during the Women‚Äôs World Cup 2025 by referencing ‚ÄúAzad Kashmir‚Äù on air, leading to calls for her removal from the commentary panel for politicising sport. This controversy overshadowed Pakistan‚Äôs dismal performance, as they were restricted to 129 runs by Bangladesh‚Äôs disciplined bowling attack.

title: 'Get back, he has a bomb': Video of UK attack shows cops neutralise suspect; 2 dead
content: A violent attack outside a Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur left two dead and three critically injured. Police confronted an armed man, with an officer heard shouting about a bomb during the evacuation. The incident, involving a car and stabbing, prompted the Prime Minister to condemn the assault and deploy additional security to UK synagogues.

title: IT Ministry opens real money games ban, esports registration rules, up for consultation
content: The draft Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Rules, 2025 would set up an Online Gaming Authority of India, and set a framework for registration of esports.

title: T.N. in worst position with regard to safety of Scheduled Castes, alleges Governor Ravi
content: He alleges that the SC community faced increasing problems, including not being able to walk freely on the streets and students are being divided¬†in classrooms

title: Jawahirullah criticises Centre for releasing commemorative coin, stamp on centenary of RSS
content: He asserts that the portrayal of uniformed RSS volunteers as having taken part in the 1963 Republic Day parade on the stamp ‚Äòamounted to distortion of history‚Äô

title: A startup revolution, the goal of ‚Äòinnovation capital‚Äô
content: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs strategy to facilitate startups and spark innovation is moving to the next chapter ‚Äî as the Tamil Nadu Global Startup Summit 2025

title: Luxury drive on an illegal route
content: The Cochin Customs recently cracked down on the reported illegal import of luxury cars to India from neighbouring Bhutan and seized a few vehicles owned by movie actors and celebrities. M.P. Praveen finds out the modus operandi of the alleged smugglers and the illegal routes of vehicle import to India

title: Taliban ‚ÄòForeign Minister‚Äô Muttaqi to visit India next week
content: Indian officials indicated that the ‚Äòtemporary exemption‚Äô that was issued by the UN Security Council‚Äôs sanctions committee on September 30 finally firmed up the plans for Muttaqi‚Äôs India visit

title: Police constables accused of rape in Tiruvannamalai dismissed from service
content: SP M. Sudhakar issues the order dismissing D. Suresh Raj and P. Sunder for raping a young woman from Andhra Pradesh

title: Rahul Gandhi ‚Äòspeaking in the tongue of Pakistan‚Äô, says Eknath Shinde
content: At the annual Dussehra celebrations organised by his party, Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticizes Rahul Gandhi for doubting the bravery of soldiers, Uddhav Thackeray for giving up Hindutva

title: Fighting for justice and rights is being termed sedition in this country, says Uddhav
content: Shiv Sena(UBT) chief calls Modi-led NDA government ‚Äúshameless‚Äù for comparing cricket with war, says Hindus are not safe under government

title: 11 killed as tractor-trolley falls into pond during Durga idol immersion in Madhya Pradesh
content: Khandwa Collector Rishav Gupta said the locals and a home guard posted near the immersion site had warned the tractor driver against going ahead but he did not listen, and the tractor plunged into water after losing control.¬†

title: It would be a shame if India found supplying weapons to Israel: Navi Pillay
content: In this interview, the former UN High Commissioner for Human Rights who chaired the Commission which spent two years documenting over 60,000 Palestinian deaths discusses the findings, the legal and moral obligations of the international community

title: Central Secretariat Service Forum demands probe into attempted suicide of official due to workplace harassment¬†¬†
content: The Central government staff had jumped from the seventh-floor office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Ministry but survived the fall; father says he spoke of harassment by senior officers and feeling depressed

title: Congress launches revamp of U.P. organisation; focus on Jats, Gurjars, Passi, Nishad, Lodhi, forward castes
content: Congress plans to appoint 2 million office-bearers in UP, engaging with caste groups to revive party fortunes.

title: Several NDA allies send congratulatory messages to the RSS on centenary
content: The congratulatory messages from the NDA partners, many of whom also receive support from minority communities, is significant in what it says about the inner cohesion of the alliance

title: Experts, citizens slam Karnataka‚Äôs plan for metro line to Tumakuru, call suburban rail a better alternative
content: The proposed line would cost an estimated ‚Çπ20,649 crore in its first phase, this figure has raised eyebrows among citizens and mobility advocates

title: Integrated Child Development Services‚Äô name changed but governance hasn‚Äôt kept pace: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: Recalling 50 years of the Integrated Child Development Services, renamed and subsumed under the Mission Saksham Anganwadi and POSHAN 2.0, the Congress flagged the need for additional workers, services, and funds

title: Andaman L-G briefs PM Modi on progress of mega projects on islands
content: Lieutenant Governor Admiral D.K. Joshi (Retd)  apprised the PM Modi of the highest-ever tourist arrivals in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, with domestic arrivals up by 41% and foreign arrivals by 27% over the past year

title: Seemanchal: religion, caste and the never-ceasing struggle for livelihoods
content: The demography of the place, the overarching influence of the Bharatiya Janata Party from the Centre, and the fragmented polity ensure that simple equations of communal and caste support continue to over-determine electoral variables in the region

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan compares RSS to Zionists in Israel
content: Opposition criticises release of commemorative stamp and coin on Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh centenary

title: Karur stampede: Why was Vijay not named as an accused, asks Thirumavalavan
content: ‚ÄúWhy should the police file a case against four functionaries of the TVK and arrest two of them? On the other hand Mr. Vijay is being given security. Then, can we say that there is secret understanding between the DMK and Mr. Vijay?‚Äù

title: Thrissur comes alive with Vidyarambham ritual as children step into the world of letters
content: The ceremony, blending spirituality with cultural heritage, was celebrated at temples and institutions across the district

title: Old clothes to get a makeover at this training programme
content: Mithrakulam Charitable Trust in Ernakulam to train at least 10 people at their place on designing and creating unique products out of old clothes

title: Muslim girl performs Kathakali at Kerala Kalamandalam for the first time in 95 years
content: 16-year-old Sabri makes her debut in the Krishna ‚Äòvesham.‚Äô She joined the institution in 2023 and was taught the first ‚Äòmudras‚Äô by maestro Kalamandalam Gopi

title: US In "Armed Conflict" With Drug Cartels, Trump Tells Congress
content: President Donald Trump has determined the United States is engaged in "a non-international armed conflict" with drug cartels, according to a document notifying Congress of its legal justification for deadly U.S. strikes on boats off Venezuela.

title: Sending Long-Range Missile To Ukraine Will Harm Ties: Putin Warns Trump
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the United States that supplies of long-range missiles to Ukraine will seriously damage relations between Moscow and Washington but will not change the situation on the battlefield.

title: UK Terror Attack: Police Say Attacker Is British Citizen Of Syrian Origin
content: An assailant drove a car into people outside a synagogue Thursday in northern England and then began stabbing them, killing two and seriously wounding four in what police called a terrorist attack on the holiest day of the Jewish year.

title: "Grim Reminder Of Evil Forces Of Terrorism": India Condemns UK Terror Attack
content: India on Thursday condemned the deadly terror attack on a synagogue in Britain's Manchester, and said it is yet another grim reminder of the challenge the world is facing from the "evil forces of terrorism".

title: "Then What's NATO?" Putin Mocks Trump's "Paper Tiger" Jibe At Russia
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday promised a "significant" response to "Europe's militarisation", as he addressed a foreign policy forum in southern Russia.

title: Shops, Schools Up To Class 8 To Reopen In Ladakh As Situation Returns To Normal
content: With the situation limping back to normalcy after violent clashes on September 24 left four people dead in Leh, the authorities have ordered reopening of all schools up to Class 8 from Friday.

title: Rain Drenches Dussehra Festivities In Delhi, Events Of PM Modi, Amit Shah Cancelled
content: Rain dampened Dussehra festivities at many places in the national capital on Thursday, drenching the effigies of Ravan and leading to the cancellation of events which were to be attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: With Fewer Overseas Students, Dozens Of Colleges In US Announce Budget Cuts
content: DePaul University has told faculty it will immediately reduce spending following a 30% decline in international enrollment this fall.

title: 'Seeking Justice Becoming Treason': U Thackeray Slams Sonam Wangchuk's Arrest
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday targeted the BJP over the arrest of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk in connection with the violence in Ladakh last month and asserted that fighting for rights is becoming an act of treason

title: European Leaders Overheard Mocking Trump Over Armenia-Albania Mix-Up
content: US President Donald Trump's repeated muddling of global geography turned into comic relief for world leaders at a European summit this week.

title: Trump Asks 9 Colleges To Commit To His Political Agenda For Favorable Access To Funds
content: The White House is asking nine major universities to commit to President Donald Trump's political priorities in exchange for more favorable access to federal money.

title: Health Blogger 'Adversely Influenced' Daughter's Cancer Treatment
content: A UK coroner ruled a British health blogger who promotes conspiracy theories had "adversely influenced" her daughter to refuse chemotherapy, causing her death from cancer.

title: 'Decision To Not Act Against Pak After 26/11 Treachery': Eknath Shinde Jabs Congress
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde seized on Congress leader P Chidambaram's remarks and said the UPA government's decision not to strike Pakistan after the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack "under someone's pressure" amounted to "treachery"

title: Eiffel Tower Closed Due To Strikes Across France Against Austerity
content: Protesters took to the streets of more than 200 towns and cities across France to denounce spending cuts and demand higher taxes on the rich.

title: Haryana YouTuber Wasim Akram Arrested For 'Spying' For Pakistan's ISI
content: Police in Haryana's Palwal have arrested a YouTuber named Wasim Akram on charges of spying for Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) and its High Commission, officials said on Thursday.

title: Emmanuel Macron To Name France's New Government This Weekend: Report
content: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to name a new government this weekend,putting together a leaner team under Sebastien Lecornu, as he seeks to resolve a deepening political crisis, sources told AFP on Thursday.

title: US Embassy Updates Applicants About Passports, Visa Services Amid Government Shutdown
content: The US Embassy in India on Wednesday assured applicants that passports and visa services will continue despite the government shut down underway in Washington.

title: 'Drunk' Cop Crashes Car Into 3 Vehicles In Dehradun, Suspended
content: The SHO of Rajpur police station in Dehradun has been suspended after he rammed his car into three vehicles one after the other, driving allegedly under the influence of alcohol, police said on Thursday.

title: Daily Hearings In Madhya Pradesh's OBC Quota Case And Its Big Complications
content: The Supreme Court will begin day-to-day hearings on Madhya Pradesh's move to grant 27 per cent reservation for Other Backward Castes or OBCs. The hearings will begin on October 8.

title: Kremlin On Alert As US Considers Tomahawks, Wider Intel For Kyiv: Reports
content: The Kremlin said that the United States and the NATO alliance were already supplying intelligence to Ukraine on a regular basis, in response to reports that Washington would provide intelligence on Russian energy targets to Kyiv.

title: 2026 class: Risers, teams with early edges, more
content: Which five-star recruits are still on the board? What to know with six weeks until the early signing window.

content: The new tool will generate lay person summaries of complex scientific research, Shivkumar Kalyanaraman, the CEO of India‚Äôs newest science funding agency said

title: Religious rites, ceremonial traditions mark Wadiyars‚Äô Dasara
content: Unlike the State-sponsored festival, which is more of cultural events and sports, the Navaratri, as celebrated by the Wadiyars, entails rigorous observance of religious rites as prescribed in sacred texts under the supervision of trained priests

title: Gandhi adopting the principle of non-violence made him a Mahatma, says Shashil Namoshi

title: Kannammoola-Nellikuzhy road work to be taken up soon
content: Residents of the area have been facing difficulties due to the road, which has been in a state of disrepair for a long time. Autorickshaw drivers as well as food delivery workers have generally been reluctant to venture into the road

title: Telangana second only to Karnataka in cyber crimes; Hyderabad among worst-hit metros

content: This was perhaps one of the largest-ever surrenders by Left-wing extremists in a single day in Chhattisgarh

title: Telangana prisons run below capacity as most of India battles overcrowding

content: "the first one is always like, 'Oh, go out there. Good job, buddy'," Nacua says . the first one normally ends up being six slaps because the first three, they're like, "I don't want to hurt you," he adds . he says he's "the best wide receiver in football"

title: The latest buzz: More on the Ravens‚Äô struggles, Titans' trauma and potential QB trades
content: the "Get Up" crew discusses what's gone wrong with the Ravens this season . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they are also diving in on the Titans' 0-4 start and long-term ramifications of it .

title: A Purdy good strategy: How 49ers have planned for roster turnover after extending QB
content: the 49ers began laying the path to quarterback Brock Purdy four years before it happened . in the 2021 offseason, the Niners decided quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo was not in their long-term plans . tuesday's game was a big success .

title: Finals first look: How the Aces and Mercury match up
content: the Las Vegas Aces and Phoenix Mercury will meet in the 2025 WNBA Finals . the franchises have both won multiple titles but have never met in the championship series before . Phoenix eliminated the no. 1 seed Minnesota Lynx 3-1 on Sunday .

title: Week 6 preview: Vanderbilt-Alabama, a Sunshine State showdown and more
content: it has been nearly 365 days since the Commodores downed then-No. 1 Alabama in a stunning upset last October . Florida State host no. 3 Miami this weekend after suffering its first loss in overtime thriller at Virginia .

title: An all-time hater, years of shade and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .
